documentation.text:
Modify the maximum allotment of a beneficiary in `_distributionType` pool.
@dev The beneficiary allotment can be increased in all conditions, but
can be decreased only if the beneficiary has not withdrawn more than the
proportion of the total tokens calculated according to the decreased allotment. 
This is to avoid the `Token Misallocation` scenario.
`Token Misallocation` scenario:
1. A beneficiary B1 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 60%
2. Another beneficiary B2 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 40%
2. An issuance of 1000 tokens is added and the B1 withdraws
600 tokens
3. The allotment of B1 is decreased to 50%
4. The allotment of B2 is increased to 50%
5. B2 now tries to withdraw 500 tokens, but B1 has already withdrawn
600 tokens. This will cause the smart contract to throw an error since 
it doesn’t have the required balance to transfer to B2
To avoid this scenario, verify that the total withdrawal of B1 is 
less than 500 tokens in the case of maximum allotment decrease
@param _distributionType The type of the pool
@param _beneficiary The beneficiary whose allotment is to be modified
@param _newBeneficiaryAllotment The new allotment of the beneficiary

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(enum FanTokenIssuance.DistributionType => struct FanTokenIssuance.TokenIssuance storage ref)

documentation.text:
Modify the maximum allotment of a beneficiary in `_distributionType` pool.
@dev The beneficiary allotment can be increased in all conditions, but
can be decreased only if the beneficiary has not withdrawn more than the
proportion of the total tokens calculated according to the decreased allotment. 
This is to avoid the `Token Misallocation` scenario.
`Token Misallocation` scenario:
1. A beneficiary B1 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 60%
2. Another beneficiary B2 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 40%
2. An issuance of 1000 tokens is added and the B1 withdraws
600 tokens
3. The allotment of B1 is decreased to 50%
4. The allotment of B2 is increased to 50%
5. B2 now tries to withdraw 500 tokens, but B1 has already withdrawn
600 tokens. This will cause the smart contract to throw an error since 
it doesn’t have the required balance to transfer to B2
To avoid this scenario, verify that the total withdrawal of B1 is 
less than 500 tokens in the case of maximum allotment decrease
@param _distributionType The type of the pool
@param _beneficiary The beneficiary whose allotment is to be modified
@param _newBeneficiaryAllotment The new allotment of the beneficiary

documentation.text:
If any excess tokens are transferred to this contract without 
adding it to any distribution pool, this function can be used to 
recover the amount

devdoc.details: Adds the tokens to be issued, add the beneficiaries

params._beneficiaryAllotment: The total amount in this pool to be allocated to the beneficiary

addTokenIssuance(uint8,uint256).details: Adds new issuance to the `_distributionType` pool. This will be called daily

params._issuanceAmount: The amount of tokens to be issued in this batch

returns.success: true if the issuance was added successfully.

getAllotment(uint8).details: Get the total tokens allotted to requestor in the specified pool

getPoolWithdrawableAmount(uint8).details: Get withdrawable amount of the requestor in the `_distributionType` pool. The amount withdrawable is proportional to the maximum amount of tokens allocated to the beneficiary. The forumla for the amount withdrawable is provided in the code below.

getPoolWithdrawnAmount(uint8).details: Get the amount withdrawn by the requestor from the specified pool

getWithdrawableAmount().details: Get withdrawable amount of the requestor across all pools.

getWithdrawnAmount().details: Get the total amount withdrawn by the requestor from all pools

modifyBeneficiaryAllotment(uint8,address.details: The beneficiary allotment can be increased in all conditions, but can be decreased only if the beneficiary has not withdrawn more than the proportion of the total tokens calculated according to the decreased allotment.  This is to avoid the `Token Misallocation` scenario. `Token Misallocation` scenario: 1. A beneficiary B1 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 60% 2. Another beneficiary B2 is added with an initial allotment. Example: 40% 2. An issuance of 1000 tokens is added and the B1 withdraws 600 tokens 3. The allotment of B1 is decreased to 50% 4. The allotment of B2 is increased to 50% 5. B2 now tries to withdraw 500 tokens, but B1 has already withdrawn 600 tokens. This will cause the smart contract to throw an error since  it doesn’t have the required balance to transfer to B2 To avoid this scenario, verify that the total withdrawal of B1 is  less than 500 tokens in the case of maximum allotment decrease

params._beneficiary: The beneficiary whose allotment is to be modified
params._newBeneficiaryAllotment: The new allotment of the beneficiary

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeBeneficiary(uint8,address).details: Only beneficiaries who have not withdrawn any tokens can be removed from the pool to avoid the `Token Misallocation`  scenario.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawPoolTokens(uint8).details: function to withdraw tokens of the requestor from a pool

devdoc.title: Contract to issue tokens according to distribution pools.

addBeneficiary(uint8,address,uint256).notice: Add beneficiary to the `_distributionType` pool. A beneficiary can belong to more than one pool and their balance will be calulated separately

modifyBeneficiaryAllotment(uint8,address.notice: Modify the maximum allotment of a beneficiary in `_distributionType` pool.

recoverExcessTokens().notice: If any excess tokens are transferred to this contract without  adding it to any distribution pool, this function can be used to  recover the amount
